projects.title: La Cour Médiévale De Mon Seigneur Ambert
projects.descShort: This site aims to manage the convention "La Cour Médiévale De Mon Seigneur Ambert", a medieval convention taking place at Montby Castle, in Doubs. This convention was entirely conceived and designed by the site’s team of developers.
projects.descFull: This project was carried out in a group of 5 students and allowed us to practice our skills in web development, project management and communication. The site allows to manage registrations of participants, activities proposed, stands and animations, as well as practical information about the event. This application was created using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, VueJS and Postgresql technologies as well as the agile SCRUM methodology for project management.

content.title: The database
content.desc:
To set up the database, I started by carrying out a MCD with another student in order to identify the different tables and associations that would constitute it. For this, we used the Looping tool which is a conceptual data modeling software. 
On the other hand, we made the decision to use PostgreSQL as a database management system because it offers the ability to store and database tables quite easily.
Then, we asked about the method to use for queries to the database: pure SQL or using an ORM. We opted for the use of the ORM Sequelize. This decision was justified by the fact that it simplifies interaction with the database, and allows for better code readability.
After completing all these steps and installing Sequelize in the project, we created the Sequelize templates. These templates are used to inform the ORM of all details related to each table: its name, its attributes with their types, its associations with other tables, etc.

content.title: The backend
content.desc:
For the backend part of our application, we created a REST API using NodeJS, a JavaScript framework known for its flexibility and performance. This API allows us to communicate with our database, extract the necessary data, process it as we need and send it back to the frontend.
Thanks to this API, we are able to perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on our data. For example, we may retrieve specific information, add new data, update existing records or delete them from the database.
Using NodeJS also gives us the ability to asynchronously manage incoming requests, which helps optimize performance and ensure a responsive user experience. In addition, the advanced JavaScript features offered by NodeJS make it easier to process data before sending it back to the frontend.

content.title: The frontend
content.desc:
Our site was developed entirely using Vue.js, a modern and powerful JavaScript framework for building user interfaces.  Vue.js offers a responsive and component-based approach, which allows us to create interactive and dynamic pages. Thanks to its ease of use, Vue.js has allowed us to develop our frontend quickly and efficiently.
With Vue.js, we were able to split our interface into reusable components, which makes maintenance and future updates easier. Vue.js advanced features, such as state management with Vuex, routing with Vue Router and custom directives, allowed us to implement complex features while maintaining clean and structured code.
In addition, Vue.js offers excellent integration with other libraries and tools, which has allowed us to enrich our site with additional functionality. Thanks to the flexibility of Vue.js, we were able to create a smooth and pleasant user experience.
